alert.note: Alert for Andrews; Howard; Martin (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued October 03 at 5:41PM CDT until October 03 at 6:15PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Southeastern Andrews County in western Texas... Northwestern Howard County in western Texas... Martin County in western Texas... * Until 615 PM CDT. * At 540 PM CDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 15 miles southeast of Andrews to 14 miles north of Midland to 6 miles south of Lenorah to 7 miles west of Big Spring, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 167 and 171. Locations impacted include... Lenorah, Knott, Tarzan, and Stanton Municipal Aiport. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
